title: New World identity
content:
Anyone fancy a stab at this one? MyFonts didn't come up with a match...   
   
 ![wild new world strap](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000832im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20883.gif)
author: porky

comments.content:
Well tis quite a bit heavier and wider than Industria, so I've ended up making the glyphs I need myself instead - however, if anyone does identify it, I'd still really like to know.   
   
PS: Its the German spelling ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000832im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000832im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20894.gif)

Wow, Tiff, thanks for mentioning FF World!   
Muchmusic (Latin America) uses it a lot. I always wondered   
what typeface was that, but never figured it out. :-)

\>\> But, with a little patience, my incorrect ID   
 will shortly summon the correct ID from either   
BJ or Grant.   
   
thanks...uh, I mean, ouch... ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000832im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
I feel like that, too, which is why I like to phrase my IDs   
in the form of a question...   
   
Could that be Futura?   
   
10 minutes later from a Top IDer\*, "Actually that's the 1987 Letraset Cut, Futura No. 4."   
   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000832im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
bj
